compatibility.warning: GPL version 1 allows software to be used for commercial purposes
GPL version 1 requires that code not be released under in binary-only form
GPL version 1 does not explicitly forbid binary-only forms of code be released if the releasing party is otherwise legally unable to release source-code
GPL version 1 requires that any new modifications be released under the same license
GPL version 2 allows software to be used for commercial purposes
GPL version 2 requires that code not be released under in binary-only form
GPL version 2 does not explicitly forbid binary-only forms of code be released if the releasing party is otherwise legally unable to release source-code
GPL version 2 requires that any new modifications be released under the same license
The MIT License allows software to be used for commercial purposes
Code distributed under The MIT License has no warrantee given.
The MIT License does not deny the distribution of source-code in binary form only.
The MIT License itself does not deny the distribution of source-code in binary form only, whether or not it is legally required for other reasons.
The MIT License requires that any new modifications be released under the same license
The MIT License requires that its copyright notice remain in 'all copies or substantial portions of the Software.'
